segment.source: Use font glyphs when implementing your own gripper UI.
segment.target: Use font glyphs when implementing your own gripper UI.

segment.source: The gripper is a combination of two Segoe UI fonts that are available system-wide.
segment.target: The gripper is a combination of two Segoe UI fonts that are available system-wide.

segment.source: Using font resources simplifies rendering issues at different dpi and works well with the various UI scaling plateaus.
segment.target: Using font resources simplifies rendering issues at different dpi and works well with the various UI scaling plateaus.

segment.source: Additional usage guidance
segment.target: Additional usage guidance

segment.source: Text selection and manipulation is particularly susceptible to user experience challenges introduced by touch interactions.
segment.target: Text selection and manipulation is particularly susceptible to user experience challenges introduced by touch interactions.

segment.source: Mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard input are highly granular: a mouse click or pen/stylus contact is typically mapped to a single pixel, and a key is pressed or not pressed.
segment.target: Mouse, pen/stylus, and keyboard input are highly granular: a mouse click or pen/stylus contact is typically mapped to a single pixel, and a key is pressed or not pressed.

segment.source: Touch input is not granular; it's difficult to map the entire surface of a fingertip to a specific x-y location on the screen to place a text caret accurately.
segment.target: Touch input is not granular; it's difficult to map the entire surface of a fingertip to a specific x-y location on the screen to place a text caret accurately.

segment.source: Considerations and recommendations
segment.target: Considerations and recommendations

segment.source: Use the built-in controls exposed through the language frameworks in Windows to build apps that provide the full platform user interaction experience, including selection and manipulation behaviors.
segment.target: Use the built-in controls exposed through the language frameworks in Windows to build apps that provide the full platform user interaction experience, including selection and manipulation behaviors.

segment.source: You'll find the interaction functionality of the built-in controls sufficient for the majority of UWP apps.
segment.target: You'll find the interaction functionality of the built-in controls sufficient for the majority of UWP apps.

segment.source: When using standard UWP text controls, the selection behaviors and visuals described in this topic cannot be customized.
segment.target: When using standard UWP text controls, the selection behaviors and visuals described in this topic cannot be customized.

segment.source: Editable and non-editable content
segment.target: Editable and non-editable content

segment.source: With touch, selection interactions are performed primarily through gestures such as a tap to set an insertion cursor or select a word, and a slide to modify a selection.
segment.target: With touch, selection interactions are performed primarily through gestures such as a tap to set an insertion cursor or select a word, and a slide to modify a selection.

segment.source: As with other Windows touch interactions, timed interactions are limited to the press and hold gesture to display informational UI.
segment.target: As with other Windows touch interactions, timed interactions are limited to the press and hold gesture to display informational UI.

segment.source: For more information, see Guidelines for visual feedback.
segment.target: For more information, see Guidelines for visual feedback.

segment.source: Windows recognizes two possible states for selection interactions, editable and non-editable, and adjusts selection UI, feedback, and functionality accordingly.
segment.target: Windows recognizes two possible states for selection interactions, editable and non-editable, and adjusts selection UI, feedback, and functionality accordingly.
